alert.note: Alert for Lake (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 09 at 2:22PM MST until November 09 at 3:15PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: The National Weather Service in Missoula has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Lake County in northwestern Montana... * Until 315 PM MST. * At 220 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Kings Point, or 7 miles northeast of Polson, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow leading to visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes the following highways... Highway 93 N between mile markers 23 and 85. Highway 200 W near mile marker 115. Locations impacted include... Polson, Ravalli, Ronan, St. Ignatius, Pablo, Jette, Turtle Lake, Kings Point, Rocky Point, Kerr, Big Arm, Allentown, Round Butte, Kicking Horse, Charlo, Fort Connah, Elmo, Finley Point and Dayton. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
